email.subject: Research Fellow in Edge Software Vulnerability Detection at Queen's University Belfast, UK

position.title: Research Fellow-Edge Software Vulnerability Detection
position.school: School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

details.description: The Post holder will be a highly productive, ambitious and collaborative member of the National Edge AI Hub research project at Queen's University Belfast.

activities_responsibilities.details: Investigate, characterise, and develop ontologies of software vulnerabilities in the edge computing environment.
Monitor and/or analyse source code (and data), software behaviours, and software environment to identify potential vulnerabilities and assess their impacts.
Predict or identify vulnerabilities early, to fix them quickly and effectively, preventing potential exploitation.
Investigate the software quality certification/robustness to cyber disturbances, cyber-attacks, on federated/distributed EC environment.

activities_responsibilities.activity: Identify quality issues with AI models
activities_responsibilities.details: Implement on edge and offer mitigation strategies to resolve the challenges.

candidate_requirements.expected_qualification: PhD degree in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, or Computer Science
relevant_experience: Undertaking research in Artificial Intelligence, Software Engineering, Edge Computing, and/or Cybersecurity.
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Keras, or TensorFlow.
Solid understanding of edge intelligence and software vulnerabilities.
Working effectively as part of a research team.
Strong publication record commensurate with stage of career.
